kick off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if a meeting, event, or a football game kicks off, it starts
kick off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: What time does the laser show kick off?
The match kicks off at noon.
The series kicked off with an interview with Brando.
kick off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if you kick off a discussion, meeting, event etc, you start it
kick off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: OK Marion, would you care to kick off?
I’m going to kick off today’s meeting with a few remarks about the budget.
kick off.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to remove someone from a team or group
kick off.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Joe was kicked off the committee for stealing funds.
kick off.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if a fight kicks off, people start fighting
kick off.translation[0].definitions[4].e: I think it might kick off in here with all these football fans around.
kick off.translation[1].definitions[0].d: if an investment kicks off payments, it produces those payments for the investor
kick off.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Single-state muni funds kick off income that is exempt not only from federal taxes but from state taxes as well.
kick off.translation[1].definitions[1].d: if a meeting, event etc kicks off or you kick it off, it starts
kick off.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The conference was scheduled to kick off at noon.
The company will kick off its advertising campaign in the UK next week.
